title: Henderson, Colorado
text:
Henderson, formerly known as Henderson Island, is an <a href="Unincorporated%20area">unincorporated community</a> and a <a href="United%20States%20Postal%20Service">U.S. Post Office</a> in <a href="Adams%20County%2C%20Colorado">Adams County</a>, <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>, United States. Henderson has the <a href="ZIP%20Code">ZIP Code</a> 80640. Portions of the Henderson area have been annexed by <a href="Commerce%20City%2C%20Colorado">Commerce City</a>, <a href="Brighton%2C%20Colorado">Brighton</a>, and <a href="Thornton%2C%20Colorado">Thornton</a>.
A post office called Henderson has been in operation since 1894. The community was named after <a href="John%20D.%20Henderson">John D. "Colonel Jack" Henderson</a>.
Geography.
Henderson is located at (39.921586,-104.868279). Henderson Island is today the site of the Adams County Regional Park and Fairgrounds.
Current Day.
Along with a post office, a few buildings remain of old Henderson along Brighton Road north of 120th Avenue. The Henderson Congregation Church (now Henderson Community Church) which has been in existence for over 100 years, stands as one of the last remaining vestiges of historical Henderson.
Education.
<a href="School%20District%2027J">School District 27J</a> serves Henderson.
Businesses.
Henderson is currently home to <a href="MYR%20Group%20Inc.">MYR Group Inc.</a> and MYR Group subsidiary Sturgeon Electric Company, Inc. MYR Group is one of the leading electrical contractors in the United States and is publicly traded on the <a href="NASDAQ">NASDAQ</a> under the stock symbol MYRG.
